ygData.subject: Re: everquest-jewelry making, thus far..
ygData.msgSnippet: Freeport is probably a good place to do jewelry, since that militia belt quest improves your faction with the local merchants.  I recomend you get everyone
ygData.messageBody:
Freeport is probably a good place to do jewelry, since that militia belt
quest improves your faction with the local merchants. I recomend you
get everyone nice and friendly to you before you spend much money, as
jewelry is a big platinum sucking black hole!

-----Original Message-----
From: Shawn Alley [mailto:ShawnA@...]
Sent: Wednesday, April 21, 1999 1:33 PM
To: 'eqenchanters@onelist.com'
Subject: [eqenchanters] Re: everquest-jewelry making, thus far..


From: Shawn Alley <ShawnA@...>

Thanks! If you can find Jasper I think this is a good gem for skill
level 21-22. Carnelian, one step up on the jeweler I saw is too hard
for me as of yet I think. I know it's more likely for your skill to go
up when you do harder things, but it's too expensive to fail :)

Also, more helpful info:
For those who don't know, a person who sells gems (actually more than
one) are in the mage guild place in west freeport. There's one outside
by the birdguy and there's one or more inside upstairs I think. A
person who sells bars of silver, etc. is in north freeport. If you go to
the bank area and leave the marketplace area there will be a building in
front of you and you have to turn left or right. The door close by to
the left goes into a room where a lady is selling jewelry and bars.
I'll add this to the page as well. Happily the prices are identical
even though I'm dealing with humans now and my quoted prices were from
Felwithe (high elves)

Shawn
Azara, high elf enchantress

-----Original Message-----
From: jcent@... [mailto:jcent@...]
Sent: Wednesday, April 21, 1999 11:03 AM
To: shawna@...
Cc: eqenchanters@onelist.com
Subject: [eqenchanters] everquest-jewelry making, thus far..


From: jcent@...


Shawn,

FYI, regarding your jewelry website....

As I mentioned in my post to the group, I've also maxed my skill in
training points (21?) and have not yet seen a raise in skill after about
5
successes(non 'trivial') and 3 successes (trivial at my level) and 2
failures.....so your formula seems right on...2 of 10 attempts failed at
my
level. i was, of course, using enchanted silver, too...and have not
yielded a magical item yet. I am using cat's eye at this point, as the
lapis and hematite gives me 'trivial at your skill level' messages.

BTW, the carnelian/silver combo will make a wedding ring. I've made one
of
two attempts at that.

Fistlebane
